com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection

Class OrderedRegistry<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.collection.OrderedRegistry<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The element type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<T>

    public final class OrderedRegistry<T>
extends Object
implements Iterable<T>
    Simple registry implementation which contains named elements and ensures that iteration order is the same as insertion order.

    Iteration, while predictable, is somewhat costly in that it always occurs over a copy of the underlying collection. This is to all for concurrent modifications in the presence of iteration. The assumption here is that the registry is neither modified nor iterated very often. Performance is optimized for retrieving elements by their names.

    This implementation does not support null names nor does it support attempts to add elements with existing keys.

    This class is thread safe, including in the presence of concurrent modifications in one thread and iteration in another thread. The iterating thread will not see the modifications until the next iteration.
